Docs.summary: A that occupies the entire screen.
Docs.remarks: is primarily a base class for more useful derived types. Objects that are derived from the class are most prominently used as the top level UI element in .NET MAUI applications. In addition to their role as the main pages of applications, objects and their descendants can be used with navigation classes, such as or , among others, to provide rich user experiences that conform to the expected behaviors on each platform.

Docs.param: Title of the displayed action sheet. Can be to hide the title.
Text to be displayed in the 'Cancel' button. Can be null to hide the action.
Text to be displayed in the 'Destruct' button. Can be to hide the destructive option.
The flow direction to be used by the action sheet.
Docs.summary: Displays a platform action sheet, allowing the application user to choose from several buttons.
Docs.returns: A that displays an action sheet and returns the string caption of the button pressed by the user.
Docs.remarks: Developers should be aware that Windows line endings, CR-LF, only work on Windows systems, and are incompatible with iOS and Android. A particular consequence of this is that characters that appear after a CR-LF, (For example, in the title) may not be displayed on non-Windows platforms. Developers must use the correct line endings for each of the targeted systems.

The body text of the prompt dialog.
Text to be displayed on the 'Accept' button.
Text to be displayed on the 'Cancel' button.
The placeholder text to display in the prompt. Can be when no placeholder is desired.
The maximum length of the user response.
The keyboard type to use for the user response.
A pre-defined response that will be displayed, and which can be edited by the user.
Docs.summary: Displays a prompt dialog to the application user with the intent to capture a single string value.
Docs.returns: A that displays a prompt display and returns the string value as entered by the user.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the page busy state. This will cause the platform specific global activity indicator to show a busy state. This is a bindable property.

remarks.para: Setting to on multiple pages at once will cause the global activity indicator to run until all are set back to . It is the developer's responsibility to unset the flag before cleaning up a page.

Protected Overridable Function OnBackButtonPressed () As Boolean
abstract member OnBackButtonPressed : unit -> bool override this.OnBackButtonPressed : unit -> bool

Docs.summary: Determines the behavior when the back button of the page is pressed.
Docs.returns: when the back navigation was handled by the override, otherwise .

remarks.para: Application developers can override this method to provide behavior when the back button is pressed. When overridden to handle or cancel the navigation yourself, this method should return .
This only works on Android and UWP for the hardware back button. On iOS, this method will never be called because there is no hardware back button.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnDisappearing() cil managed
abstract member OnDisappearing : unit -> unit override this.OnDisappearing : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, allows the application developer to customize behavior as the page disappears.
Docs.remarks: This method is called when the page disappears due to navigating away from the page within the app. It is not called when the app disappears due to an event external to the app (e.g. user navigates to the home screen or another app, a phone call is received, the device is locked, the device is turned off).
